page.title: 10Working In The Denmead Area.
page.content: Denmead and Wecock are both primarily dormitory towns for workers from the major towns and cities that lie within 10-20 miles of our area. Employment within our area is very limited. Most employment in our area is in farming, market gardening or part-time work in shops and pubs. There is also some light engineering industry developing now on the outskirts of Denmead. Although there is very little employment available in Denmead unemployment is relatively low. Male unemployment is at about 5%, female unemployment is at about 6% and youth unemployment at about 16%. The dominant feature of employment here is that of commuters. Most of the people who live here are employed elsewhere and so the need for jobs here remains low.
